item.title: Moped abandoned in car park, 17th June
item.description:
Moped appeared overnight a few nights ago, in a poor condition and i suspect it may be a stolen vehicle and dumped or stored at location as its a car park on a quiet side street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hainault Street, New Eltham, London

item.title: 6-8 Evangelist Roaf, 17th June
item.description:
Raised this 6 months ago and got an email saying it's fixed. Tree needs securing with canvas straps and the water bag is full of holes so cannot be used. It says it's fixed but it's the same old bag from a year ago. Please can you resecure tree and put a new bag in as requested. It's not fair to say it's done when it hasn't been. Thank you asap as it's thirsty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Evangelist Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass seed at Stanhope Rec, 17th June
item.description:
There are large patches of grass with grass seed growing at Stanhope, mostly around the basketball area and the land adjacent. Every year dogs, and I guess other wildlife suffer from grass seeds entering paws, ears and eyes which causes a lot of pain and stress to the animals and most require surgery. Could the park keeper come to Stanhope and remove the long grass/seeds with a machine that picks it up at the same time. I know all the dog walkers would be very grateful!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 98, Eden Park Avenue, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree on Battersea Rise, 17th June
item.description:
I am writing to raise a concern regarding a tree located directly to the left side of my barfront, immediately adjacent to the Eccles Road bus stop on Battersea Rise. The tree has grown substantially and is now obstructing a significant amount of natural sunlight from reaching the front of my premises. I run LOCKES BAR - 11,13 Battersea Rise, and the reduced sunlight is noticeably impacting the visibility and atmosphere of our venue—particularly during peak daytime hours when light is crucial for attracting customers and enhancing their experience. I kindly request that the tree be assessed to determine whether pruning or crown reduction would be appropriate in this case.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23-25, Battersea Rise, Clapham Junction, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: N4 2LX : No refuse collection for over 3 weeks, 17th June
item.description:
We have continually been reporting that our bins have not been collected for 3 weeks now. We are getting numerous pests and it is getting worse in the heat. We have already paid for a private company to remove some of the overflow. It now beyond urgent

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London
